snippet: A mauling death brought new attention to the issue of unattended dogs, with a study finding that dog bites in the city had increased 15 percent a year since 2013....
abstract: Boston Consulting Group reports there are 8,700 loose dogs in some of southern Dallas's poorest neighborhoods; is working with city to proposes re-education efforts targeting dog owners who allow their pets to roam free and encourage spaying and neutering to control canine population; report was prompted by mauling death of woman in area by 6 dogs.
lead_paragraph: A mauling death brought new attention to the issue of unattended dogs, with a study finding that dog bites in the city had increased 15 percent a year since 2013.

headline.main: Thousands of Roaming Dogs Are Cited as Problem in Poor Areas of Dallas
headline.print_headline: Thousands of Roaming Dogs Cited as Problem in Poor Areas of Dallas
